data.title: Flea Gives The Finger On ‘Inside Out 2’ Premiere Red Carpet
data.meta_description: He might voice a cop in the latest Disney Pixar movie, but Flea is still a rebel at heart.
data.text:
He might voice a cop in the latest Disney-Pixar movie, but Flea is still a rebel at heart.

The Red Hot Chili Peppers rocker appeared to forget where he was for a moment as he posed with both middle fingers in the air on the purple carpet of Monday’s Inside Out 2 world premiere in Los Angeles.

It all appeared to be in good fun as he also busted out some dance moves for the cameras. Deadline has reached out to Flea’s reps for comment.

Despite the unexpected rockstar vibes, the event at Hollywood’s El Capitan Theatre drew plenty of families, including Ashlee Simpson, husband Evan Ross, and their brood.

Flea reprises his voice role as Mind Cop Worker Jake from the original 2015 film, which takes place inside a young girl’s mind, following the personifications of her changing emotions.

Also in attendance at the premiere was Kensington Tallman, who plays the voice of 13-year-old Riley. After Kaitlyn Dias voiced the character as a child in the first movie, the sequel follows Riley’s adventures in high school as she develops a whole new set of emotions.

Ayo Edebiri walked the red carpet, wearing the cyan color of her character Envy, a new addition in the sequel. Maya Hawke attended as well, voicing the new character Anxiety.

Returning voice actors Kyle MacLachlan (Riley’s Dad) and Lewis Black (Anger) celebrated the premiere, along with new voices Yvette Nicole Brown (Coach Roberts), Ron Funches (Bloofy, a children’s TV character) and Lilimar (popular girl Val).

Although Mindy Kaling and Bill Hader did not return to voice their respective roles, Disgust and Fear, their successors, Liza Lapira and Tony Hale, were in attendance Monday.

Inside Out 2 premieres Friday, June 13, in theaters.
